title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 November 2011 - XWiki
content:
00:22 <sburjan`> has quit  
00:28 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
06:32 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r586f01d / (5 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7191: Enhance the behavior of the extension manager when JavaScript is enabled ...  
07:40 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:48 <tekzilla> has quit  
07:50 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <CIA-102> tmortagne feature-improvecm \* ra614d08 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-component/xwiki-commons-component-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/component/embed/EmbeddableComponentManager.java : XCOMMONS-63: Optimize EmbeddableComponentManager ...  
08:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <Enygma`> has quit  
09:59 <CIA-102> tmortagne feature-improvecm \* r8f760bb / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-component/xwiki-commons-component-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/component/embed/EmbeddableComponentManager.java : XCOMMONS-65: ComponentManager#lookupList() returns duplicate components ...  
10:16 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <+sburjan> hello  
10:32 <+sburjan> I think I found an error in the mySQL INstalation documentation  
10:32 <+sburjan> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL#HInstallationSteps  
10:32 <CIA-102> tmortagne feature-improvecm \* re8a5836 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-component/xwiki-commons-component-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/component/embed/EmbeddableComponentManager.java : XCOMMONS-63: Optimize EmbeddableComponentManager ...  
10:32 <+sburjan> ther eis a line which states : <property name="connection.driver\_class">com.mysql.jdbc.Driver</property>  
10:33 <+sburjan> but in the bundled MySQL section from hibernate.cfg.xml I have a <property name="dialect">org.hibernate.dialect.MySQL5InnoDBDialect</property>  
10:33 <+sburjan> and I know we don't recomment MyISAM... so shouldn't we also update the doc accordingly to what the user gets in hibernate.cfg.xml ?  
10:46 <vmassol> Hi Guys, fyi I've discovered a very nice tool over the weekend to monitor an xwiki instance: http://code.google.com/p/javamelody/  
10:46 <vmassol> it takes 5mn to setup and is great, I'll document it on dev.xwiki.org and I propose that we use it on xwiki.org/myxwiki.org for monitoring  
10:46 <vmassol> (I'll send a mail once I've documented it)  
10:50 <+sburjan> vmassol: could you hell me if this is the XAR with the XE ? http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-ui/3.3-SNAPSHOT/  
10:51 <vmassol> it's a portion of it  
10:51 <vmassol> this is the full one sburjan: http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/3.3-SNAPSHOT/  
10:52 <+sburjan> thanks  
13:02 <mflorea> has quit  
13:13 <+Enygma`> cjdelisle or sdumitriu : anyone available for build manager duty this week?  
13:16 <+Enygma`> or anyone else, for that matter :)  
13:17 <+sburjan> Enygma`: do we have the XEM package with the Workspaces ? or it's not built yet  
13:20 <+Enygma`> it should be available as one of the latest snapshot  
13:21 <+sburjan> ok, I'll check latest XEM snapshot  
13:29 <AndreasJonsson> has quit  
13:50 <+sburjan> http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-wiki-administrator/ became http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-ui-all/ starting with 3.3 ?  
13:52 <vmassol> I don't know exactly when it started but you could check in github  
13:53 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commits/master/xwiki-manager-ui  
13:53 <vmassol> XEM-200  
13:53 <vmassol> so 3.3M1 indeed :)  
13:53 <+sburjan> ok, so we'll have to update our documentation :)  
13:54 <+sburjan> if it's gonna stay like this from now on  
13:54 <vmassol> yes it's going to stay  
13:54 <vmassol> and yes we need to update the doc  
13:54 <vmassol> if you can help us on this that would be great :)  
13:55 <+sburjan> not much to change :)  
13:55 <+sburjan> still don't know the diff between http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-ui/ and http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-ui-all/  
13:55 <+sburjan> it's confusing  
13:57 <vmassol> XE or XEM are made of several apps  
13:57 <vmassol> blog app, scheduler app, etc  
13:57 <vmassol> including some pages that are specific to XE or XEM  
13:57 <vmassol> (for ex their home pages)  
13:57 <+sburjan> ok, I see. but this might still be confusing for end-users  
13:57 <vmassol> these specific pages are in a xe-ui or xem-ui  
13:58 <vmassol> now the full distribution are in -ui-all  
13:58 <+sburjan> ok, now I understand  
13:58 <vmassol> when you install using the EM (in the future) you'll only need the -ui xar  
13:58 <vmassol> since EM knows about dependencies  
13:58 <vmassol> so the -ui-all is just something temporary  
13:58 <+sburjan> yes ..  
13:58 <vmassol> to avoid end users to have to manually install each of them  
13:59 <vmassol> till we all use the EM UI to install XARs  
13:59 <+sburjan> I will update the doc according to new location (XEM install tutorial), and put the old link inside a info/warning macro  
14:02 <+sburjan> I am setting up a XEM to test Workspaces  
14:02 <vmassol> ok  
14:02 <+sburjan> and I get a trillion of these when importing the ui-all  
14:02 <+sburjan> 2011-11-28 15:02:14,824 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/import/XWiki/XWikiPreferences] WARN  c.x.x.w.XWikiMessageTool       - The document [XAppResources.Translations] is listed as an internationalization document bundle but it does not exist.  
14:02 <vmassol> bug then  
14:02 <+sburjan> okay  
14:03 <vmassol> something for Enygma`  
14:03 <vmassol> :)  
14:03 <+sburjan> :)  
14:03 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <+Enygma`> not really  
14:08 <+Enygma`> it`s related to ApplicationManager afaik  
14:08 <+Enygma`> or, more generally... it's related to the fact that XWikiPreferences gets imported before the actual translation gets imported  
14:09 <+Enygma`> and since in XWikiPreferences it is stated that translation X is registered and it is not (yet) found, since it's an import process, the warning gets printed  
14:22 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle master \* ra2e9726 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.java : XWIKI-7193: Avoid injecting RenderingCache and DocumentDisplayer in all instance of XWikiDocuments - http://git.io/xnI5OA  
14:23 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <+Enygma`> mflorea, vmassol: anyone available for build manager duty this week?  
14:46 <+mflorea> I'm offline Thursday and Friday (and the weekend) so I'm not the best fit. I can be the build manager next week  
14:48 <CIA-102> Eduard Moraru master \* rbe793da / xwiki-manager-test/pom.xml : Fixed old validation ignore rule and added a new note about further validation work to be done. - http://git.io/PyLWcw  
14:54 <+sburjan> I have an odd question. If I donwload the XEM with mySQL zip, I baiscally get the default XE Platform + the specific jar's. When I import it, the default (blank) wiki tell me I have to download XE. My question is if that the platform is aware as being XEM capable or not. Because we have that, I'd suggest adding link to the XEM xar instead of the XE XAR  
14:55 <+sburjan> otherwise, the user will be confused and might get an XE instead of XEM  
14:58 <+Enygma`> that might be a good idea  
14:59 <+Enygma`> but a simple $xwiki.isVirtualMode() is not enough... we might need a marker in the XEM distribution to be 100% it's the right distribution  
14:59 <+sburjan> yes.. I don't know if we have that  
14:59 <+sburjan> not very familiar with XEM  
15:00 <+Enygma`> I think one solution would be to include an extra vm file in the XEM distribution that outputs a string.. like "XEM"  
15:00 <+Enygma`> and in XE, just check for it  
15:00 <+Enygma`> but this is not nice, scratch that :)  
15:01 <+Enygma`> anyway, 1st step: make an issue with this so we don`t forget about it  
15:02 <+sburjan> yes. I know there is an API method to get the version, but I don't know if that takes the version from the imported XAR or from the platform  
15:02 <+sburjan> anyway, I'll create the improvement issue  
15:17 <+sburjan> vmassol: I have a question. I am looging at http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL in the "Download XEM packages" but I don't know exactly with what I should replace those.  
15:17 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle master \* rb117c33 / (12 files in 6 dirs): XWIKI-7195: Generalize the initialization of extension at application startup for all type of extension - http://git.io/NR1-IA  
15:29 <+sburjan> ok, something is very fish in the manager dir on maven, I can't find anywhere 3.3 M1 in any builds  
15:29 <+sburjan> ok, found them, my bad  
15:44 <+sburjan> how should I report on IRA an issue that is newer than 3.3 M2 because I don't have any affectedVersions in JIRA  
15:45 <+Denis> sburjan: you should reopen the issue that has introduced the problem  
15:46 <+sburjan> Denis: and if I can't figure out the issue where the problem was introduced ? I get a nasty starcktrace with velocity chunks in it  
15:48 <+Denis> if you give more details, maybe I could helps  
15:48 <+sburjan> I only have a stacktrace  
15:48 <+Denis> pastebin it  
15:49 <+sburjan> Denis: http://pastebin.com/jLbcJnzE  
15:52 <+Denis> sburjan: were/when did you get that ?  
15:52 <+sburjan> First import of a XEM .. today's morning snapshot Jetty + mySQL  
15:58 <+sburjan> I think is somehow related to: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XEM-203 but I'm not sure  
16:03 <+Denis> but you ger XEM-203 with 3.3M2, and not the other one  
16:05 <+sburjan> I get 203 in 3.3M2, and I get the nastier one that i've put in pastebin  
16:05 <+sburjan> on the lastes tsnapshot  
16:07 <+Denis> put a link to your pastebin in XEM-203, commenting like you 've done here  
16:13 <+sburjan> done. thanks for the advice  
16:22 <+Enygma`> that's caused by workspaces  
16:23 <+Enygma`> for some unknown reason, importing WorkspaceManager.CreateNewWorkspace (I think) causes the contents of the document to be interpreted as a database name (if I can recall corectly).  
16:24 <+Enygma`> it has no negative side effects as far as I can tell  
16:24 <+Enygma`> but I can`t seem to figure out why it's doing that  
16:24 <+Enygma`> maybe it will be fixed once I convert the page from syntax 1.0 to syntax 2.0  
16:25 <+Enygma`> sburjan: related to the XEM download page... the links need to be updated  
16:25 <+Enygma`> since wiki-administrator has been renamed to ui-all  
16:25 <+Enygma`> it`s the same problem as the last time  
16:34 <+sburjan> Enygma`: the XEM dir organization is a little bit of a mess because we changed the naming strategy and I'm not familiar with it, and i have to navigate until I find what I need  
16:34 <+Enygma`> can you give me a link?  
16:35 <+sburjan> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/manager/  
16:35 <+sburjan> for example. but we can't remove them because others might need the old versions  
16:36 <+Enygma`> yes, but that's how maven repositories work.  
16:36 <+Enygma`> it's just that the documentation needs updating, not the repository :)  
16:37 <+sburjan> yes, but I don't know exactly how to update the documentation according to the new repositories. I'll need vmassol to help me  
16:38 <+Enygma`> you can ask me too if you need help  
16:39 <vmassol> sburjan: you don't need to ask me specifically :)  
16:39 <+sburjan> I only need help on one page ... http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL#HDownloadXEMpackages .. the 2 new artefact names have to be upgraded, but we also need to keep the old naming for older version  
16:40 <+sburjan> vmassol: I know I don't  :) but you're always active here, seeing you as you modify pages, etc :)  
16:41 <+Enygma`> sburjan: just put a notice "Since 3.3" and "Before 3.3" like on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Workspace+Application  
16:42 <+Enygma`> (see Prerequisites & Installation Instructions section)  
16:42 <vmassol> creating repo on contrib for guillaume sauthier  
16:44 <+Enygma`> so sburjan look at the old artefacts mentioned currently and see their last versions, then put on the current section a "Before X.X"  
16:50 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: 1.0 parser consider every [\*] as a link and try to save it in backlinks  
16:51 <+Enygma`> tmortagne: re the exception sburjan mentioned?  
16:51 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: refering to "(04:23:56 PM) Enygma`: for some unknown reason, importing WorkspaceManager.CreateNewWorkspace (I think) causes the contents of the document to be interpreted as a database name (if I can recall corectly)."  
16:52 <+tmortagne> what probably happen is that when the pafe is save some [\*] is found and the "\*:" part is checked as if it was a wiki  
16:52 <+tmortagne> it's pretty commons error log with 1.0 content  
16:53 <evalica> has quit  
16:54 <+Enygma`> so you mean explicitly the syntax "[\*]"... or just any text between square brackets?  
16:55 <+tmortagne> not exactly [\*], just meat pretty much anything between square brackets yes  
16:55 <cjdelisl1> has joined #xwiki  
16:55 <+tmortagne> which can very often have nothing to do with alink  
16:55 <+Enygma`> because looking at the code I don`t really have square brackets, except for some arrays in velocity  
16:55 <+Enygma`> do does count as well?  
16:56 <+tmortagne> yep  
16:56 <+Enygma`> oh snap...  
16:56 <+tmortagne> that's the most commons  
16:56 <cjdelisle> has quit  
16:56 <+tmortagne> but anyway it's just a log  
16:56 <+Enygma`> ok, thanks for clearing out a months long mistery :P  
16:57 <+tmortagne> I think there is some condition in which the velocity tables are not mached, you would have the check the exact regex to be sure  
16:58 <+Enygma`> anyway, now I`m sure it will go away with a syntax 2.0 conversion.  
16:58 <+tmortagne> yep that's one of the many reason to move to xwiki/2.x  
16:59 <+sburjan> Enygma`: issue is that I can't figure the name of the new artifacts  
17:03 <+sburjan> because itseems it has been a change in 3.2 also, because I can'tsee 3.2 here http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-enterprise-manager-mysql/  
17:04 <+Enygma`> because you are searching by artifact name  
17:04 <+Enygma`> and that has changes  
17:05 <+Enygma`> use nexus to navigate by version instead http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/index.html#nexus-search;quick~manager  
17:05 <+Enygma`> might be easier  
17:07 <+Enygma`> xwiki-manager-jetty-mysql and xwiki-manager-ui-all  
17:07 <+Enygma`> for 3.3  
17:08 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: what's the best way to test if a user can create a new space? (generate a random space name and test if the use can create pages there?)  
17:10 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: At the moment, yes  
17:11 <+mflorea> ok, thanks  
17:11 <@sdumitriu> There's a hasCreateSpace variable in xwikivars, or something like that  
17:11 <+sburjan> yes, jetty was confusing me :)  
17:11 <+mflorea> that would be useful, thanks  
17:17 <+sburjan> thanks Enygma`  
17:17 <+Enygma`> np  
17:19 <sburjan> has quit  
17:20 <@sdumitriu> Enygma`: I can take over the BM role  
17:22 <+Enygma`> thanks sdumitriu

17:46 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki
